questions.question_text: When is a Pump not required to connect to a source database?

choices.A: when transformations, filtering, and mapping are required
choices.B: when look-ups are needed against the source database
choices.C: when a PASSTHRU parameter is used
choices.D: when a NOPASSTHRU parameter is used

discussion.content:
Answer is c

PASSTHRU: This parameter is used to avoid lookup in database or definitions files in datapump are not doing any conversions and so on.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer
CORRECT ANSWER: C

From oracle docs
In pass-through mode (configured by PASSTHRU), the Extract process does not look up table definitions from the database or from a data-definitions file
The default of NOPASSTHRU causes the data pump to look up object definitions from a local database or a definitions file, so D is not the answer as well.
I think C is the answer

questions.question_text: A database that requires replication contains sensitive data that is not required on the target. How should you prevent this sensitive data from being replicated?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
COLS | COLSEXCEPT

These parameters are used to Replicat only specific columns from the Source to Target. Suppose, let us consider a scenario, we have 10 columns in the source and we need only 9 columns to be replicated to the target table. Yes, this is possible using the above parameters.

COLS and COLSEXCEPT controls the columns for which data is captured. It means, only data of specific columns are captured and not all the columns.
Yes! D is the correct answer.
D is the correct answer
Correct is D.
the answer must be D unless we need to mask the data ..
I think the answer should be D. That way, those columns are not written to the trailfile.
